noun.description: A member of an indigenous people living in Canada along the Ottawa River and its tributaries and westward to the north of Lake Superior.
The dialect of Ojibwa spoken by the Algonquin.

adjective.description: Relating to the Algonquin or their language.

origin: French, contraction of obsolete Algoumequin, from a Micmac word meaning at the place of spearing fish and eels.
